text: The 1989 Motorcraft Formula Ford Driver to Europe Series 1989 Motorcraft Formula Ford Driver to Europe Series, www.formulaford.com.au, as archived at web.archive.org was an Australian motor racing competition open to Formula Ford racing cars.Steve Normoyle, Larkham bound for the Continent, Australian Motor Racing Year, 1989/90, pages 238 to 245 It was the 20th Australian Formula Ford Series.Australian Titles, docs.cams.com.au, as archived at web.archive.org The series was won by Mark Larkham driving a Van Diemen RF89. ==Calendar== The series was contested over seven rounds with one race per round. {| class="wikitable" generated with :de:Wikipedia:Helferlein/VBA-Macro for EXCEL tableconversion V1.7<\hiddentext> |- style="font-weight:bold" | align="center" | Round Motorcraft Formula Ford Diver to Europe Series (race results), Australian Motor Racing Year, 1989/90, page 303 | Circuit | Date | Round winner | Car |- | align="center" | 1 | Amaroo Park | 5 March | Mark Larkham | Van Diemen RF89 |- | align="center" | 2 | Lakeside | 16 April | Mark Larkham | Van Diemen RF89 |- | align="center" | 3 | Mallala | 7 May | Mark Larkham | Van Diemen RF89 |- | align="center" | 4 | Sandown | 21 May | Michael Mortimer | Swift FB89 |- | align="center" | 5 | Winton | 4 June | Russell Ingall | Van Diemen RF89 |- | align="center" | 6 | Oran Park | 9 July | Russell Ingall | Van Diemen RF89 |- | align="center" | 7 | Amaroo Park | 6 August | Mark Larkham | Van Diemen RF89 |} ==Points system== Points were awarded on a 20-15-12-10-8-6-4-3-2-1 basis for the first ten places at each round.Official Programme, Mallala, May 7, 1989 ==Series standings== {| class="wikitable" generated with :de:Wikipedia:Helferlein/VBA-Macro for EXCEL tableconversion V1.7<\hiddentext> |- style="font-weight:bold" | align="center" | Position | Driver | align="center" | No. Motorcraft Driver to Europe Series -
